Posts.Content:
I am 4 weeks post bi-lateral mastectomy. Because surgeon said I was 
"chubbie" (179 lbs) I now have rolls of skin under both armpits which
are extremely uncomfortable and cannot get used to. As to the bi-lateral
mastectomy, it feels like my chest is being crushed. I previously had 2 breast
surgs with same surgeon in Dec. 2010 and radiation which obviously did not
work necessitating surgery of 4 weeks ago. Does anyone have any 
suggestions or have had this similar experience. This is driving me crazy.
Got back in touch with surgeon's office and they said to put heating pad
on chest. Thank you. Bouvier PS Of course I have the expected nerve
pain which is minor considering what is going on.
Posts.Title: (No Subject)

Posts.Content:
Hi Bev, Thank you for your quick reply and your knowledge.
Thankfully, I do not need chemo. I will consider the plastic surgeon
idea for the future. Did not know about
 possibility of adhesons -no
one told me about
 that - especially my surgeon. Thank you for
your help. It is greatly appreciated. Hugs to you. Bouvier
PS Decided not to go with reconstruction as I have had 4 major
surgs and radiation treatments within the last 18 months and
reconstruction was the last thing I wanted after going through
bi-lateral mastectomy. Just wanted it done with. But I do think
the idea of plastic surgeon to get rid of the "rolls" under the 
arms in the future is a good one/cannot wear a bra with
prosthesis at this point (have to wait 6 wks post surg. anyway
to even shop) - could only wear a chami with prosthesis.
Thanks again for caring. You know, that digging in/crushing
feeling/I wonder if that could be the adhesons/will get back
in touch with original surgeon. Thanks again.
